pull.title: Reject dust amounts during validation
pull.body:
Replaces the validation check for "amount == 0" with an isDust check,
so very small output amounts are caught before the wallet
is unlocked, a transaction is created, etc.

repo.name: bitcoin-git
repo.description: Feature branches that aren't yet, or never will be, ready for mainline bitcoin

events.message:
Reject dust amounts during validation

Replaces the validation check for "amount == 0" with an isDust check,

events.body:
Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/6407dc93a5165aaf016118bad211d8415b92f4e7 for binaries and test log.
This test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/current/
Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.
ping @gavinandresen Wasn't this included in your paymentrequest-pull?
@Diapolo : yes, this was part of the paymentrequest pull.  Closing.

comments.body: Any reason to bother copying the script?
Oh, or are you suggesting that an empty CScript would work for the isDust() call?  CTxOut::isDust() does use the size of the scriptPubKey.

Resolved.

@gavinandresen I missed the fact that it uses the serialized size.
